meanings.definition: To plant (different types of plants) among each other in a mixed arrangement.
meanings.sent1: The gardener interplanted flowers and vegetables in the same garden bed.
meanings.sent2: The farmer interplanted corn and beans to maximize space in the field.
meanings.sent3: The forest animals interplanted acorns and pine cones for a playful game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The artist interplanted colors on the canvas, creating a vibrant masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The students interplanted seeds in the science experiment, observing their growth over time.

meanings.definition: Planted among each other in a mixed arrangement.
meanings.sent1: The interplanted flowers created a beautiful mosaic of colors in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The interplanted trees provided a diverse habitat for various bird species.
meanings.sent3: The interplanted herbs seemed to whisper secrets to each other in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent4: The interplanted shrubs formed a natural barrier against the wind.
meanings.sent5: The interplanted vegetables flourished together, sharing nutrients in the soil.
